title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, and entering an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999' in the 'defaultValue' field, the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design:
<parameters>
<scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
<property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
<property name="allowBlank">false</property>
<property name="format">Unformatted</property>
<property name="controlType">textbox</property>
<expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
</scalarparameter>
</parameters>
Two problems here:
(1) The model should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format ('yyyymmddThh:mm:ss') as per [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/], which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject invalid date/time strings when creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter and display an appropriate error message.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter.
3. In the 'defaultValue' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid value is rejected and an error message is displayed.
